results.title: A Tale of two shamba's
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Julian Sprio
results.brief_description: Shamba is Swahili for small holding, and this is the story of two East African farmers. Joseph, who is part of a co-operative, prospers, but Peter, who neglects his farm for a job in the city, requires help from Joseph and the local bank. The services of the bank and the importance of co-operative farming in Kenya are emphasised.

results.title: A Tale of Two Cities
results.creator_credit: Barry Letts, BBC-TV, Time-Life Television, ABC-TV (Australia) and Michael E. Briant
results.brief_description: Sydney Carton, wastrel and dissolute, black sheep and fallen angel, whose words on the scaffold secure him a place in the quotation books, remains as potent a creation today as he was when Dickens’ poignant classic was first published. His ‘double’, Charles Darnay, who mirrors what Carton could have been and who wins the hand of Lucie whom Carton also loves, remains a satellite of goodness in this tale of sacrifice and hate. Their lives and fates, inextricably linked, merge again in the figure of Paul Shelley who brings them both to life in this authentic dramatisation.

results.title: A Tale of two cities
results.brief_description: A pictorial record of the effects of the dropping of atomic bombs by the USA on the Japanese cities of Nagasaki and Hiroshima, in August 1945. Made for US Service personnel, featuring dramatic music and narration.

results.title: A Tale of the fiords: a story to see and hear
results.brief_description: A re-edit of a Swedish film originally produced by Arne Sucksdorff. A Norwegian tale about little Ragnhild who yearns to find the legendary valley ofdreams across the fiord. She slips away from her task of milking goats on the mountainside and dreams that she has found her valley.

results.title: A Tale of summer
results.brief_description: The quiet countryside is always close at hand in Sweden, irrespective of whether a person lives in a big town or in a small village. Thanks to a special law opening up private land to the general public, you can go almost anywhere without hindrance. Arne Sucksdorff, photographer and film director, tells of the fantastic adventures of a small fox cub in the Swedish Wood in early summer.

results.title: A Tale of 'O' on being different
results.brief_description: Rosabeth Moss Kanter (narrator) explores the consequences of being different. It focuses on a group where there are ‘the many’, referred to as the ‘X’s‘ and ‘the few’, referred to as the ‘O’s’. What makes a person an X or an O?

results.title: A Tale for everybody
results.brief_description: An animated film about two little bugs who become so pre-occupied playing on an egg that they fail to notice when the egg cracks and a baby chick appears.

results.title: A System for Handling Sport Injuries
results.brief_description: Sport injuries occur regardless of the age or skill of the athlete or the level of competition. This film provides a comprehensive approach to the many types of sports injuries that can occur in any sporting event and outlines a system for determining injury type and the immediate forms of treatment applicable.

results.title: A Swiss peasant artist
results.brief_description: The original paper silhouettes of the artist Jean Jacques Hanswirth in the Chateau D’Oex Museum are photographed in stop motion so that they seem animated. Relates the story of the Swiss peasant whose craft with scissors and paper became an art.
